sentences.en: A dungeon with Christ a thronea throne without Christ a hell.
sentences.cn: 除非你活在基督里,不然对神而言你是死的.

sentences.en: He practiced the immurement of his enemies in the castle dungeon.
sentences.cn: 他把敌人关押在城堡地牢中.

sentences.en: He was incarcerated ( in the castle dungeon ) for years.
sentences.cn: 他被多年监禁 ( 在古堡的地牢里 ).

sentences.en: He was just set free from a dungeon a few days ago.
sentences.cn: 几天前,他刚从土牢里被放出来.

sentences.en: He whom I enclose with my name is weeping in this dungeon.
sentences.cn: 有人以我的名字被囚禁起来，正在地牢里哭泣。

sentences.en: I could now see more clearly the nature of the dungeon.
sentences.cn: 现在我能更清楚地看清地牢的情况.

sentences.en: John had Maude and her son cast into a dungeon.
sentences.cn: 约翰让人将莫德和她的儿子关进了地牢。

sentences.en: She barely looked the idea in the face, and hastened to bar it in its dungeon.
sentences.cn: 她只能对这个念头匆匆一瞥, 便又急忙将其闭锁在它的地窖里.

sentences.en: So the Magician fell upon him, and beat him, and loaded him with chains, and cast him again into the dungeon.
sentences.cn: 于是魔术师又扑到他身上狠狠的打他，用链条把他锁起来，又把他扔到地牢里。

sentences.en: The dungeon can only be started in rookie systems.
sentences.cn: 保护区只能在新手系统内开始.

sentences.en: The dungeon had numerous tools in it, including a rack.
sentences.cn: 地牢中有许多刑具, 包括拉肢刑架.

sentences.en: The dungeon was , most unusually, already full of vapors and odd smells.
sentences.cn: 异乎寻常的是, 地下教室已经充满了各种蒸气和古怪的气味.

sentences.en: The first one was built in 642 and it contains the dungeon. As for the second one, it was built in the end of the 17th century.
sentences.cn: 修道院包括了两座教堂，第一座建造于公元642年，其中包括了囚禁圣格利高里的地牢，而第二座则完工于17世纪末期。

sentences.en: Then he looked around him, and really recognized his dungeon.
sentences.cn: 他向四周看看, 完全看清了他曾呆过的黑牢.

sentences.en: This place is awful like a dungeon!
sentences.cn: 这地方真要命,象个土牢!

sentences.en: Throw him into the dungeon and leave him there.
sentences.cn: 把他扔进地牢,让他呆在那儿.

sentences.en: Today's asylum might be the dungeon of tomorrow.
sentences.cn: 今天的庇护所可能会变成明天的地牢.

sentences.en: You can arrest him. You can throw him a dungeon.
sentences.cn: 你可以逮捕他, 甚至把他关进地牢.

trans.tran_en: a dark underground prison, especially under a castle, that was used in the past
